page.title: 20Stream Geography,Rutland
page.content: Through the middle of the study area there is an East-West shallow valley containing an unamed small stream, which is 1-3m wide, slowly moving and overgrown. It is a parish boundary throughout its length,to the east Ridlington-Ayston and to the west Preston-Ayston. The stream disappears in the west just south of Ridlington. On the eastern margin of the study area this stream passes under the Glaston Road between Preston and Wing Burrows. Very slightly to the west of this point the parish boundary divides into three and all three branches pass eastward out of the area. The stream may have orginally been continuous with the Eye Brook which currently deviates sharply southwards at Allexton into the Eye Brook Valley; this is called{river capture.}
